title: Android 13 could support spatial audio with head tracking on compatible devices
content:
Spatial audio with head tracking reimagines how we enjoy listening to our music and video content. For those unfamiliar with the technology, it provides a 3D sound experience that reacts to the listener’s movements. It requires a compatible device, speaker, and audio file. Once you meet the prerequisites, the sound will adapt as you move

The post Android 13 could support spatial audio with head tracking on compatible devices appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Android 13 could fully support spatial audio with head tracking, assuming the device and audio product are compatible with it.
